profileText: A Delegate from the Territory of Nebraska; born in Salisbury, Litchfield County, Conn., August 24, 1821; attended the public schools; studied law; was admitted to the bar and commenced practice in Elyria, Lorain County, Ohio; moved to the Territory of Nebraska and settled in Omaha; was editor of the Omaha Nebraskan 1855-1859; elected as a Democrat to the Thirty-fourth Congress (March 4, 1855-March 3, 1857); unsuccessfully contested the election of Fenner Ferguson to the Thirty-fifth Congress; died at Put in Bay, Ottawa County, Ohio, September 21, 1871; interment in Ridgelawn Cemetery, Elyria, Ohio.

note.content: Election unsuccessfully contested by Hiram P. Bennett.

researchRecord.name: 1864, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A letter from Bird Beers Chapman to E. W. Hubbard written on June 24, 1864. In the letter, Bird Beers Chapman discusses personal matters and the prospects of Abraham Lincoln's re-election as U.S. president in 1864.

researchRecord.name: In the Thomas B. Cuming Papers, 1822-1913, 1 cubic foot and 1 microfilm reel.
researchRecord.description: Correspondents include Bird Beers Chapman. A finding aid is available in the repository.
